summary: Split is Croatia's second-biggest city, located on the Adriatic Sea. It started as a Greek colony called Asp√°lathos and later became important when the Roman emperor Diocletian built his palace there in 305 CE. Over time, it was ruled by many, including the Byzantines, Venice, and the Habsburgs. Today, it's a popular tourist spot with over 900,000 visitors yearly, known for its history and connection to the Adriatic islands.
title: Split, Croatia
